author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: President Trump blasted the Supreme Court over its ruling temporarily blocking expedited deportations of alleged Venezuelan gang members.
title: Trump rails against Supreme Court over blocking of deportation flights

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: The House Republican Study Committee has proposed a resolution to block former FBI director James Comey from ever holding a federal role again, following his controversial Instagram post that was interpreted as a call to assassinate President Trump.
title: GOP seeks to bar James Comey from federal positions

author: Joseph Choi
description: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) announced Friday it had cleared a new test to help diagnose adults with Alzheimer’s disease, the first diagnostic tool that uses a blood draw to check for the illness. The test is called the “Lumipulse G pTau217/ß-Amyloid 1-42 Plasma Ratio” and is developed by the Japanese company Fujirebio Diagnostics…
title: FDA clears first blood test to reliably predict Alzheimer’s disease

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Pope Leo XIV has offered to host a peace deal between Russia and Ukraine at the Vatican, while Cardinal Pietro Parolin called the failure of the two sides to reach a truce in Istanbul "tragic".
title: Pope Leo XIV to offer the Vatican for Russia-Ukraine discussions

author: Mike Lillis
description: President Trump’s legislative agenda is hanging by a thread as House Republican leaders scramble to make last-minute changes to their “big, beautiful bill” and cut deals to appease warring factions of the party. The latest setback came Friday, when four spending hawks tanked a key vote in the House Budget Committee to advance the legislation…
title: Trump agenda bill hanging by a thread after GOP hard-liners tank key vote

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: The federal judge overseeing the case of Kilmar Abrego Garcia, the man mistakenly deported to El Salvador, blasted the Trump administration Friday for not giving her enough material to decide whether it can invoke the state secrets privilege. U.S. District Judge Paula Xinis said a declaration submitted by Secretary of State Marco Rubio, which seeks…
title: Judge says DOJ’s explanation for state secrets privilege in Abrego Garcia case ‘insufficient’

author: Filip Timotija
description: U2’s lead singer Bono claimed during a recent interview that the possibility of another world war breaking out is more likely now than at any point in his lifetime.  “Nationalism is not what we need. We grew up in a very charged atmosphere in Ireland. It makes you suspicious of nationalism and those animal spirits…
title: Bono: World war more likely than at any point in my lifetime

author: Tobias Burns
description: Many different think tanks and legislative analysts in Washington have been sounding an alarm that the GOP tax-and-spending cut bill has greater advantages for wealthier taxpayers than it does for working Americans. But one group is projecting that lower earners will not only receive smaller benefits from the bill but will actually be financially worse…
title: GOP tax bill would shrink incomes for low earners: Analysis

author: Joseph Choi
description: Labor unions say layoffs at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health (NIOSH) are threatening science even as some employees get their jobs back. In a statement released Friday, the American Federation of Government Employees (AFGE) said the layoffs at the Department of Health and…
title: Federal workers union says HHS layoffs ‘targeting science’

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: A federal judge on Friday indefinitely blocked the Trump administration from pulling back more than $11 billion in public health funding from state and local health departments.   The ruling from Judge Mary McElroy of the U.S. District Court for the District of Rhode Island extends a temporary restraining order she issued in April that…
title: Federal judge extends block on HHS termination of billions in public health funds

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: An accused serial killer who was executed for murder in Florida on Thursday used his final words to express support for President Trump after offering comfort to his family and his victims’ families. “President Trump, keep making America great. I’m ready to go,” Glen Rogers, 62, said just before he died by lethal injection for…
title: Florida serial killer cheers Trump in his final words at execution

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: The Supreme Court extended its order temporarily blocking the Trump administration from swiftly deporting alleged Venezuelan gang members being detained in portions of Texas, chastising the administration for not giving them more due process.  Over the dissents of conservative Justices Clarence Thomas and Samuel Alito, the emergency decision prevents authorities from removing the migrants under the Alien Enemies Act as…
title: Supreme Court extends block on some Alien Enemies Act deportation flights

author: Brooke Migdon
description: Texas lawmakers voted Thursday to repeal the state’s longstanding ban on gay sex, sending legislation to do so to the state Senate in a historic and bipartisan vote.  Texas’s defunct ban on “homosexual conduct,” defined in the state’s penal code as “deviate sexual intercourse with another individual of the same sex,” has not been enforceable since 2003,…
title: Texas House approves repealing ban on ‘homosexual conduct’

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Boeing is reportedly set to avoid criminal charges in the 737 Max plane crashes case and instead may enter into a non-prosecutorial settlement with the DOJ, which could allow it to compete for government contracts.
title: DOJ could drop Boeing criminal charge in deadly 737 Max crashes, families say

author: Filip Timotija
description: Five House Republicans voted against advancing President Trump’s “big, beautiful bill” on Friday, which contains his legislative agenda.  House Republican fiscal hawks sunk a key vote on the president’s One Big Beautiful Bill Act, with the final tally being 16-21.  The five House Republican members who voted no on Friday were: Chip Roy (Texas), Ralph…
title: These Republicans voted against advancing Trump’s ‘big, beautiful bill’

author: Sharon Udasin
description: Sens. Mark Kelly (D-Ariz.) and John Curtis (R-Utah) have launched a bipartisan push aimed at strengthening water infrastructure across the U.S. West — an arid region coping with a growing population and ever-dwindling resources. The senators this week introduced the Restoring WIFIA Eligibility Act, a bipartisan and bicameral bill that seeks to unlock federal funding…
title: Utah, Arizona senators launch bipartisan push for water infrastructure funding

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump’s allies are targeting former FBI Director James Comey over his “8647″ social media message, which they claim was a call for the president’s assassination. But making the case could be difficult, given protections for free speech and the broad meanings behind the eighty-sixing of someone. In contrast to other administration officials who issued…
title: Trump World has tough case with Comey over ‘assassination’ message

author: Crystal Bonvillian
description: Part of the controversy surrounding weight loss drugs like Ozempic and Mounjaro involve their side effects.
title: Are weight loss drugs safe? Learn some of the side effects

author: David Kirichenko, opinion contributor
description: Ukraine is transforming into a technology-driven army, with drones accounting for up to 80 percent of Russian casualties, while Putin's desperation grows as his economy falters and his regime becomes more paranoid.
title: Putin’s growing anxiety mirrors Russia’s failures on the battlefield

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: The Trump administration asked the Supreme Court on Friday to lift a judge’s order blocking mass layoffs at 21 federal agencies.  It marks the latest bid by the Justice Department to rein in district judges who’ve issued nationwide injunctions blocking President Trump’s policies. The department said the lower ruling “far exceeds anything necessary to remediate the parties’ putative…
title: Trump administration asks Supreme Court to lift block on mass layoffs

author: Rob Taub
description: Uber's Route Share option will initially launch in New York City, San Francisco, Chicago, Philadelphia, Dallas, Boston and Baltimore.
title: Uber introducing budget-friendly option for commuters

author: Filip Timotija
description: Former Social Security Commissioner (SSA) Martin O’Malley violated the Hatch Act during an interview with a local news outlet in North Carolina last year, a U.S. Office of Special Counsel (OSC) investigation found on Friday.  The office began the probe after a complaint was filed on Oct. 23, 2024, that alleged O’Malley, who at the…
title: Ex-SSA Commissioner Martin O’Malley violated Hatch Act, watchdog finds

author: Judy Kurtz
description: President Trump is indicating there’s bad blood between him and Taylor Swift once again, reigniting his feud with the music star and claiming credit for what he describes as a drop in her popularity. “Has anyone noticed that, since I said ‘I HATE TAYLOR SWIFT,’ she’s no longer ‘HOT?'” Trump wrote Friday on Truth Social. Some of…
title: Bad blood: Trump takes new swipe at Taylor Swift

author: Alexander Bolton
description: The top-ranking Democrats on the Senate Foreign Relations, Intelligence and Armed Services committees warned President Trump in a letter Thursday that his administration’s tariff policy is hurting American security interests by antagonizing allies in Europe and Asia. The senators argued that Trump’s tariff policy will not only cost the average American household approximately $2,800 per…
title: Democrats warn Trump tariffs harming national security interests

author: Emily Brooks
description: Fiscal hawks on the House Budget Committee on Friday sunk a key vote on advancing the “One Big Beautiful Bill Act” that encompasses President Trump’s legislative agenda, marking a stunning setback for the legislation. The 16-21 vote throws up a hurdle for leaders hoping to send the bill to the Senate by Memorial Day —…
title: GOP fiscal hawks sink key vote on Trump ‘big, beautiful bill’

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: The Department of Justice (DOJ) is investigating Harvard’s admissions policies to ensure the measures comply with the 2023 Supreme Court affirmative action ruling, according to the university, in the latest investigation after Harvard defied the Trump administration. “This investigation is yet another abusive and retaliatory action — the latest of many — that the administration…
title: DOJ investigating Harvard over admissions policy compliance

author: George Arison, opinion contributor
description: If we are going to defeat HIV, we cannot abandon our commitment to fully fund research, and we cannot walk away from our work to treat and prevent the disease.
title: Trump promised to end HIV by 2030 — we can’t turn back now

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: Senate Judiciary Committee Democrats are pressuring Chair Chuck Grassley (R-Iowa) to hold a hearing on Kilmar Abrego Garcia, arguing the panel should review the lack of due process in his case, as he was shipped to a notorious prison in El Salvador. “The Constitution prohibits the deprivation of life, liberty, or property without due process…
title: Democrats call for hearing on Abrego Garcia deportation

author: Julia Mueller
description: Former Rep. Beto O’Rourke (D-Texas) said ex-President Biden “failed this country in the most important job that he had” and should not have run for reelection in 2024. “Just to be clear, Biden should not have run again. And to be even more clear, he failed this country in the most important job that he…
title: O’Rourke: Biden ‘failed this country in the most important job that he had’

author: Rob Cohen, opinion contributor
description: The reckless destruction of USAID is a travesty for those who want more efficiency in government, because DOGE’s methods and results discredited a rare opportunity to substantially cut red tape while improving services.
title: USAID whistleblower to Congress: Don’t rubberstamp DOGE’s destruction

author: Former Rep. Val Demings (D-Fla.), opinion contributor
description: Congress must pass the AM Radio for Every Vehicle Act to ensure public safety, even if it takes time to achieve broader royalty reform.
title: Congress must prioritize emergency readiness over industry gridlock

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Republican Sen. Markwayne Mullin (Okla.) says that Sen. John Fetterman (D-Pa.) seems to be “cognitively better” today than when he first came to the Senate in 2023 after suffering a debilitating stroke, pushing back on reports that Fetterman is going through a mental health crisis. “I came in with John, right, and I travel with…
title: GOP senator: Fetterman ‘cognitively better today’ than ‘when he first came in’

author: Jordan Perkins
description: A new study from the Journal of the American Heart Association found that men die from a condition known as "broken heart syndrome" at more than twice the rate that women do.
title: Men are more likely than women to die of ‘broken heart syndrome’: Study

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: The Corporation for Public Broadcasting has amended its bylaws regarding the removal of members of its Board of Directors.   The CPB, which overseas top taxpayer funded outlets like NPR and PBS, this week passed a measure which now states “no Director may be removed from the Board by any person or authority, including the President…
title: Corporation for Public Broadcasting moves to block Trump firings

author: Filip Timotija
description: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-N.Y.) said this week that she has not gotten a response from the Department of Justice (DOJ) on the potential investigation into her over a migrant webinar she held in February.  “I asked them, they haven’t responded to me, but, you know, once again, I’m fully using the First Amendment to inform…
title: Ocasio-Cortez: No DOJ response on potential investigation for migrant briefing

author: Julia Shapero
description: Meta asked a federal judge Thursday to toss the Federal Trade Commission’s (FTC) case against the social media giant, arguing the agency failed to prove at trial that the company violated antitrust laws.   The Facebook parent contends the agency failed to show that it has a monopoly over personal social networking and that its…
title: Meta asks judge to toss FTC case

author: Julia Falo, opinion contributor
description: The California Institute for Scientific Research would keep crucial public health funding alive for California universities and research companies.
title: Trump is killing the science that powers our future — California must act to save itself

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump on Friday urged Republicans to fall in line and support the massive reconciliation package amid sparring among members on the Hill over various provisions. “Republicans MUST UNITE behind, ‘THE ONE, BIG BEAUTIFUL BILL!'” Trump posted on Truth Social from his flight back to Washington from the Middle East. Trump argued that the law…
title: Trump hits GOP ‘grandstanders,’ urges party to pass ‘big beautiful bill’

author: Brett Samuels
description: Officials from Ukraine and Russia met Friday in Turkey for the first direct peace talks since Russia’s invasion in February 2022 sparked the more than three-year-long war. The talks lasted roughly two hours, according to Turkey’s Foreign Ministry. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky had traveled to Turkey for the talks, but Russian President Vladimir Putin did…
title: Russians, Ukrainians meet in Turkey for first peace talks in years

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) confirmed it is in the early stages of vetting a potential reality show that would have immigrants competing for a fast-track to citizenship. As first reported by The Daily Mail, producer Rob Worsoff, the mind behind shows such as “Duck Dynasty,” approached the department about the idea, in which he…
title: DHS mulls reality show for immigrants seeking US citizenship

author: Rafia Zakaria, opinion contributor
description: When the Indian attack began, Pakistan made unexpected and shocking gains within the first few hours of fighting
title: Did Pakistan just win against India?

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump said Friday that Iran has to move quickly on a new nuclear deal proposal, after he teased that the U.S. and Iran are inching closer to an agreement. Trump confirmed to reporters on Air Force One on his way back to Washington from the Middle East that the U.S. has given Iran a…
title: Trump: Iran has to ‘move quickly’ on new nuclear deal proposal

author: The Hill staff
description: The House Budget Committee is charging toward a key vote Friday on the GOP bill filled with President Trump’s priorities — even as a group of hardline conservatives threatens to block it. The Budget Committee is the next stop for the 1,116-page bill, dubbed the “One Big Beautiful Bill Act.” The panel combined portions of…
title: Live updates: Conservatives storm off, then return as key panel meets on Trump’s ‘big, beautiful bill’

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Fox News host Greg Gutfeld attacked Bruce Springsteen after the singer heavily criticized President Trump during an overseas tour. “Trump has annexed the territory of common sense,” Gutfeld said on Thursday’s edition of “The Five.” “And you have the Dems outside looking in, and they are convinced that it is just better to keep moving…
title: Gutfeld knocks Springsteen for Trump criticism in UK

author: Nicholas Calio, Opinion Contributor
description: Although this historic overhaul will require significant investment, the cost of doing nothing will far outweigh the cost of these improvements.
title: Air traffic modernization is decades overdue, but Trump is finally going to get it done

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump said that he thinks former FBI Director James Comey’s Instagram photo of seashells on a beach arranged to form the numbers “8647” was a call for his assassination, saying that the Justice Department will deal with the repercussions. The post on Thursday, which Comey has since removed, garnered significant blowback from much of…
title: Trump: Comey post ‘meant assassination’

author: Filip Timotija
description: More than 400 New Jersey Transit train engineers went on a strike just past midnight Friday in a dispute over pay, affecting more than 350,000 New Jersey and New York City commuters.  The Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers and Trainmen (BLET) announced that NJ Transit’s 450 engineers and trainees will be striking after failing to reach…
title: NJ Transit train engineers strike, affecting 350K commuters

author: Corinne Moore
description: Crews have begun cleaning up after a line of strong storms barreled across West Michigan Thursday night, bringing down trees onto homes and power lines, and spawning a number of radar-confirmed tornadoes.
title: Clean up begins after strong storms rip through West Michigan

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: President Trump has fired hundreds of employees at Voice of America as his government aims to trim down the size of the federal broadcaster and retool its editorial strategy. The nearly 600 employees who were first from VOA this week include mostly contractors, The New York Times reported, noting that figure represents about a third…
title: Trump administration fires almost 600 Voice of America employees

author: Amanda Kavanagh | This Column was created by Jobbio
description: At Trump’s inauguration in January, the reelected president was flanked by a number of tech CEOs and owners, who also happen to be some of the richest men in the world. Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg, Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos, Google CEO Sundar Pichai, and Elon Musk of Tesla, SpaceX and X were all photographed prominently.…
title: Majority of Americans say corporate influence in government threatens democracy

author: Cara McClellan, opinion contributor
description: It’s time for lawmakers across the country to act to ban unfair and discriminatory school discipline practices.
title: Trump seeks a return to America’s racist roots — and he’s moving fast

author: Liz Peek, opinion contributor
description: DOGE chief has been thwarted at every turn — by judges, Democrats and their media allies, even Republicans.
title: DOGE isn’t meeting its goals — you can thank the political establishment

author: The Hill Staff
description: The House Budget Committee on Friday morning is holding a markup of the GOP’s “big beautiful” reconciliation bill, which seeks to advance President Trump’s legislative priorities. The panel of lawmakers is expected to focus mainly on the expansion of Trump’s 2017 tax cuts and state and local tax (SALT) deduction caps. The legislation also includes…
title: Watch live: House Budget Committee considers Trump’s legislative agenda

author: Xavier Walton
description: The company has been accused of illegally misrepresenting some of its cereals, such as Trix and Lucky Charms, as "healthy."
title: Texas AG investigating General Mills over ‘healthy’ cereal claims
